attributes.description: A supply chain shows you where the products you use daily comes from and where the raw materials are collected.  The links in the chain include raw materials, the manufacturing, shipping to distribution centers, and consumers.  I never knew that it takes so much money and steps just make to something. Also it cost more to make it then buy it. Created by: Jamaal
attributes.title: black creek arrow 2

attributes.description: First they soften the wood so it  bend to an angle and then they poke hole through the top and bottom so the bow string can go in.
attributes.title: wood
steel
attributes.description: Steel is used in different parts of arrows and bows like the arrow can be made out of steel. Steel is heated and then formed into its shape. Then it goes through a cooling thing so it can harden. Last of all they pack it and then ship it off to the factory.

attributes.title: factory
attributes.description: First they take the wood and then they take the the steel tip and put it in the top of the wood were it is edged at. Then they take the bow and the raw twisted hide then put it through the hole and tie it where it won't fall out.

attributes.title: bamboo
attributes.description: Bamboo can be used for an arrow. Bamboo Is curved thin and then they edge a line into the top of the bamboo. Then they put it in a packing box to be shipped out.

attributes.title: flint
attributes.description: Flint was used to make fire when caveman were alive and then the Aztec used it as a weapon. Flint is collected then curved to its shapes. Then they are pack and ship out.

attributes.title: twisted rawhide
attributes.description: Twisted rawhide is ripped off of animals hide and the shaved off the fur that is still attached. Then you soak the rawhide in to cool water for a few hours. Then you fold it and twist 5 to 6 times.

attributes.title: distribution
attributes.description: They ship it off to the consumers

attributes.title: steel to factory
attributes.footprintmethodology:

(2010) Okala Design Guide 2010

attributes.description: wood is bend in to an angle then put thought a cooling produce. Then they poke hole though the top and the bottom.
attributes.title: wood to factory
